DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: MARTELLI, V.;MARTELLI, V;MARTELLI, VALENTINA;Valentina Martelli;V. Martelli;Martelli, V.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: VM is currently working as Assistant Professor at the Institute of Physics at the University of São Paulo (from 2019). Her research is focused on the study of thermal and thermoelectric properties in materials with non-trivial topology (bulk and thin-films). From 2020, she heads a Tandem Research Group supported by a Jovem Pesquisador Grant (FAPESP in collaboration with the Max Planck Institute). She graduated at the University of Florence (PhD in 2012, Master 2008, Bachelor 2006) and she worked as PostDoc at the Vienna University of Technology (2012-2015) and at the Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisas Físicas (2015-2018).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Exploring quantum phase transitions and quantum critical behaviours by means of thermal transport and thermoelectricity. The project focuses on the developing of new facilities to allow measurements of these physical properties at low and very low temperatures and under magnetic field.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTELLI, V.;MARTELLI, V;MARTELLI, VALENTINA;Valentina Martelli;V. Martelli;Martelli, V.

Consortium for materials science and technology

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Termoelectricidade de materiais próximos a pontos críticos quânticos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Development of experimental methods for the investigation of quantum materials. Emphasis on thermoelectricity. Materials investigated: CeRu4Sn6, SrTiO3, Bismuth thin films.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTELLI, V.;MARTELLI, V;MARTELLI, VALENTINA;Valentina Martelli;V. Martelli;Martelli, V.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Thermal and thermoelectric investigation of quantum critical materials
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The aim of this proposal was the investigation of thermal and thermoelectric behaviour of quantum critical materials across a quantum phase transition. To reach this goal we will perform thermal conductivity (k), thermopower (S) and Nernst effect (N) measurements under moderate and high magnetic field and down to very low-temperature (mK-temperature range). These experiments under these extreme conditions are considered experimental methods beyond the state-of-the-art. The measurement of S and k (together with electrical conductivity σ) allows determining the figure-of-merit (ZT), an important parameter which defines the level of efficiency of a thermoelectric compound. The interest for thermoelectric materials has been seeing a tremendous increase in the last years. In fact, converting waste heat into electricity, they offer the possibility to produce energy in an environmental-friendly way and to reduce the dependence on fossil fuels. However, a reliable and/or feasible characterization of thermoelectric materials is inaccessible by commercial measurement systems.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTELLI, V.;MARTELLI, V;MARTELLI, VALENTINA;Valentina Martelli;V. Martelli;Martelli, V.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTELLI, V.;MARTELLI, V;MARTELLI, VALENTINA;Valentina Martelli;V. Martelli;Martelli, V.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: 2D quantum materials for clean energy harvesting
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Thermoelectricity allows for the efficient transformation of heat into electrical power, with no greenhouse gases emissions and enhanced durability. However, the performance of the state-of-the-art thermoelectric materials lags behind the traditional sources of energy, limiting their application on a large scale. In this project, to overcome the current limitations on the heat-to-electricity conversion, we will explore a new route to leverage the unusual electronic bands of topological insulators.
